channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Global stock markets make solid gains as U.S. dollar shows weakness
item.description: The U.S. bond market is struggling with a departure from the dollar.

item.title: The Techno-Utopian Seasteaders Who Want to Colonize the Ocean
item.description: Libertarians have long looked at ocean living as the next frontier. Some wealthy men are testing the waters.

item.title: Van Gogh’s Last Painting Poses a Problem for an Idyllic French Village
item.description: It was recently determined that the artist painted his final work, “Tree Roots,” in Auvers-sur-Oise. The roots still exist, igniting a fight over thei...

item.title: Tom Friedman Thinks We’re Getting China Dangerously Wrong
item.description: The Times Opinion columnist discusses what he thinks Trump — and American policymakers — misunderstand about China in the escalating trade war.

item.title: Harvard vs. Trump, and Your (Shrinking) Chance of Being Audited
Mark Zuckerberg suggested wiping everyone’s Facebook friends and making users start again to boost the platform’s relevance
item.description: The email was revealed as part of the FTC's landmark antitrust case against Meta.

item.title: Melinda French Gates explains why her new book focuses on big transitions, and why Warren Buffett was one of the first to learn about her divorce
item.description: In 'The Next Day,' Melinda French Gates explores big transitions, including her divorce, her departure from the Gates Foundation, and turning 60.

item.title: Hermès leapfrogs LVMH to become Europe’s most valuable luxury company after the Louis Vuitton owner reported downbeat results
item.description: “Some people want to do a bit like Hermès, but it doesn’t work out at the end of the day,” Hermès executive chair Axel Dumas said in February.

item.title: The White House pressed for fast negotiations with its shock and awe tariffs. Now it can’t drum up enough interest from a ‘first mover’
item.description: The rhetoric out of Trump's cabinet on tariffs is changing, with Scott Bessent pushing for a "first mover" to sign on the dotted line for a deal with ...

item.title: Changing the Rules
item.description: We cover a White House plan to slash regulations.

item.title: Airport Warned Repeatedly on Bird Strikes Before Fatal Jeju Air Plane Crash
item.description: Operators of the airport where Jeju Air Flight 2216 crashed in December, killing 179, failed to meet both international and South Korean guidelines in...

item.title: Van Gogh’s Last Painting Poses a Problem for an Idyllic French Village
item.description: It was recently determined that the artist painted his final work, “Tree Roots,” in Auvers-sur-Oise. The roots still exist, igniting a fight over thei...

item.title: Assad Defaced: Syrians Destroy a Dictator’s Icons
item.description: Images of Bashar al-Assad and his family were emblematic of the dynasty’s grip on Syria. Though remnants linger after the regime’s ouster, the removal...

item.title: In Argentina, a Boom in Antarctic Cruises Is Straining the ‘End of the World’
item.description: Crowds of tourists bound for Antarctica have brought prosperity to Argentina’s southernmost city, but the boom is also squeezing locals and stressing ...

item.title: Inside Trump’s Rushed Effort to Deport 238 Migrants
item.description: The Trump administration sent them to a prison in El Salvador under a wartime act, calling them members of a Venezuelan gang. But a New York Times inv...
